qas.question: What area of the River Thames does the Port of London Authority's jurisdiction cover?
What agency provides fire fighting and rescue service in London?
Who oversees and manages the London Fire Brigade?

answers.text: London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

qas.question: The world's largest "free-at-the-point-of-use" ambulance service is known as what?

answers.text: the London Ambulance Service (LAS) NHS Trust

qas.question: What agency operates in conjunction with the LAS as needed?

context: <a1_0>The London Fire Brigade<a1_0/> is the statutory fire and rescue service for Greater London. It is run by the <a2_0>London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority<a2_0/> and is the third largest fire service in the world. National Health Service ambulance services are provided by <a3_0>the London Ambulance Service (LAS) NHS Trust<a3_0/>, the largest free-at-the-point-of-use emergency ambulance service in the world. <a4_0>The London Air Ambulance charity<a4_0/> operates in conjunction with the LAS where required. Her Majesty's Coastguard and the Royal National Lifeboat Institution operate on the River Thames, which is under the jurisdiction of the Port of London Authority from <a0_0>Teddington Lock to the sea<a0_0/>.
